snippet: Two groups dropped lawsuits in which they contended that Google’s book-scanning in France violated copyright, and said they would offer digital versions of their works for Google to sell.
abstract: French Publishers Association and the Societe des Gens de Lettres drop lawsuits in which they contended Google’s book-scanning in France violated copyright law; say they will offer digital versions of their works for Google to sell.
lead_paragraph: Two groups dropped lawsuits in which they contended that Google’s book-scanning in France violated copyright, and said they would offer digital versions of their works for Google to sell.

headline.seo: Google’s Book-Scanning Project Has Deal in France
headline.main: French Publisher Group Strikes Deal With Google Over E-Books
headline.print_headline: Google Has Deal in France For Book-Scanning Project
